description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5vmb7","text":"The Bcc qPCR NAD assay presented is an internally controlled duplex assay (incorporating an IAC), targeting a region of the smpB gene for the specific rapid quantitative detection of all Bcc species. This Bcc qPCR NAD assay was validated with equivalence to ISO/TS 12869:2019 with high specificity (100% when tested on an extensive panel of target and non-target microorganisms with no cross-reactivity observed) and high analytical sensitivity (relatively low LOD and LOQ at 3 GE/reaction with ≥90% probability and 20 GE/reaction, respectively). The high performance of the calibration function of the Bcc qPCR NAD assay in terms of accuracy, qPCR efficiency and broad dynamic calibration range (20 GE-107GE/reaction) will allow for the absolute quantification of the starting Bcc DNA concentration in contaminated samples. The incorporation of the IAC into the Bcc qPCR NAD assay ensures the robustness and fidelity of the results generated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":124,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":705,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4idho","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ch2a","text":"The development and validation of this Bcc qPCR NAD assay has been published in: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5c8j1","text":"Duong HT, Fullbrook S, Reddington K, Minogue E, Barry T. Design, Development and Validation of a Culture-Independent Nucleic Acid Diagnostics Method for the Rapid Detection and Quantification of the Burkholderia cepacia Complex in Water with an Equivalence to ISO/TS 12869:2019. PDA Journal of Pharmaceutical Science and Technology. 2023. doi:10.5731/pdajpst.2021.012728","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":199,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"dltju","text":"The laboratory workspace and equipment were sterilized by UV-light, DNase solution, and 70% ethanol. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gkgk","text":"Due to the sensitivity of the assays, extra care must be paid to avoid sample contamination during analysis, and as such Good Laboratory Practice must be followed. Wear laboratory coats and gloves at all times.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fpfe","text":"Filter pipet tips were used in all steps of the laboratory work.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"829s1","text":"The material to be used (tubes, tips, water, etc.) must be free of nucleases.\n","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: qPCR, Burkholderia cepacia complex, nucleic acid diagnostics

incorporated into the primary Bcc qPCR NAD assay. This is carried out to eliminate false negative interpretation of NAD diagnostic data, which may result from the presence of inhibitory substances in the sample matrix, thermocycler malfunction or problems with the Bcc qPCR NAD assay reagents.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

parent_protocols.title: The culture-independent Bcc NAD method for the rapid detection and quantification of Bcc in water

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Prepare a qPCR master mix (in a DNA-free preparation hood)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9cgme","text":"Thaw qPCR reagents and samples on the bench, flick to mix and briefly spin down on a tabletop centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e941a","text":"Transfer the plate into the thermal cycler after setting it up appropriately and carry out qPCR reaction at the following conditions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rqjv","text":"95 °C for 00:10:00  ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5gle","text":"95 °C for 00:00:10 ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3qe2","text":"62 °C for 00:00:30 ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ev24","text":"Repeat steps 2-3 50cycles (Fluorescent products were detected once every cycle, at the end of the extension phase)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42qb1","text":"40 °C for 00:00:10 ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Set up a qPCR plate (in a PCR template addition hood)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"110uh","text":"Aliquot 15 µL of master mix to each well of a 96-well PCR white plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kgt8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jrv8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8lb9t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9060h","text":"Mix master mix frequently while pipetting, and ensure each well's contents are mixed properly.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Prepare a qPCR master mix (in a DNA-free preparation hood)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"beald","text":"Prepare a master mix for the number of qPCR reactions, plus negative controls, positive controls (written per reaction):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvlgv","text":"10 µL 2x LightCycler 480 probes master qPCR master mix is a solution that has all of the components for a qPCR reaction except the template or control DNA.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1if69","text":"Prepare the master mix in the biosafety hood.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ffkce","text":"All the reagents and master mix should be kept on ice during the preparation.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1qckc","text":"Make sure to account for pipetting errors and make slightly more master mix than needed (add extra 1-2 reactions).","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Prepare a qPCR master mix (in a DNA-free preparation hood)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e6qhp","text":"Gently mix by inversion and briefly centrifuge to collect the liquid at the bottom of the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eoosk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Set up a qPCR plate (in a PCR template addition hood)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"flpqc","text":"Add 5 µL of each DNA sample, or 5 µL of gDNA of B. cepacia DSM7288 104 GE/reaction (for positive control), or 5 µL of nuclease-free grade water (for negative controls) into appropriate wells of the 96-well PCR white plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":48,"length":10},{"style":"sup","offset":69,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98r2f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ncjc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"286oc","text":"Samples should be run in at least duplicate, but preferably triplicate.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7el1i","text":"Keep a detailed plate map of wells containing DNA samples and positive and negative controls.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Set up a qPCR plate (in a PCR template addition hood)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"atoj2","text":"Seal the plate thoroughly with optical plate sealing film, and centrifuge briefly at low speed to ensure the contents of the wells are at the bottom. Try to remove any bubbles by gently tapping the plate against the bench and spinning again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jd9b","text":"Data analysis:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ksab","text":"Once qCPR experiment is complete, analyse the result using the LightCycler 480 software to obtain threshold cycle (Ct) signals from each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kj7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a4lq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c83k2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bko7t","text":"To determine the quantity of Bcc GE detected in each qPCR reaction, each positive result is quantified from the obtained Ct values and compared to the established Bcc qPCR NAD calibration curve: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbqu6","text":"y=-3.224x + 39.46 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":8,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mmg8","text":"where x is the log10 of the starting quantity and y is the Ct value.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":50,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":18,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn8uo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8588u","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"qbue","text":"Check that the correct filter combination has been chosen to correspond with the probe used in the experiment, e.g. HEX (for Bcc assay), or CY5 (for IAC assay). ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":2,"offset":20,"style":"sup"}],"key":"f2g37","text":"Positive control, 104 GE/reaction, is expected to amplify between Ct 26 and 27. Failure to satisfy this quality control criterion is a strong indication that the experiment has
been compromised. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e6k7q","text":"IAC signal should be detected in all samples except for the non-template control sample. IAC Ct values of 31-33 are within the normal range. ","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avhcu","text":"Turn on the LightCycler‱ 480 machine and the attached computer. Login to the computer and the designated software (LightCycler 480 software) using the login details on the computer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"83EC3BB574B011EEB7700A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"a64n6","text":"Handling high concentration of positive controls is performed in a post-PCR room, which is physically separated from the pre-PCR room to avoid contamination. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejguf","text":"Always add the samples first and seal them before adding positive control at the end.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s17s","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
